meanings.definition: To enclose in a shrine or sacred place.
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple inshrines the precious relic.
meanings.sent2: She carefully inshrines the family heirloom in a glass case.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel inshrines its acorns in a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: His love for her inshrines his heart in a protective shell.
meanings.sent5: The magical forest inshrines the spirits of the ancestors.

meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred.
meanings.sent1: The tradition inshrines the values of the community.
meanings.sent2: He inshrines the memories of his childhood in a special album.
meanings.sent3: The cat inshrines its favorite toy under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile inshrines a moment of pure joy in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The melody inshrines the emotions of the composer in every note.
